item.title: Light outside Victoria House coffee and end of Coptic Street near Fushan restaurant, 29th October
item.description:
Ref: 8333298 previously it was reported as repaired, 3 pictures taken this week and Sunday suggest the opposite. I also realised that the one outside Fushan restaurant is now not working which you can see in one of the pictures attached. Please attend as dark areas here attract ASB very quickly
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Coptic Street, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sofa, 29th October
item.description:
This has been dumped in our back entrance by my neighbour at 19 Durham Rise it’s been there a couple of years or more. I have reported it before but nothing gets done there’s vermin & attracts cats. It’s also blocked the exit to the back alley for some residents. You need a key to remove it Number 13 has a back gate key & will let you in . How many more times do we have to report this before something is done. I’m not the only person to have reported it a few of my neighbours have. Would really appreciate this being removed thank you .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durham Rise, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain causing flooding - dangerous to road users, 29th October
item.description:
Caller advising the role is completely flooded, Water is about a foot deep and this a national speed road. Cars are having to break harshly and potential slip risk and is dangerous, notable landmarks near by - Country lane no notable landmarks except a bus stop. Road is known to flood alot after heavy rain. 100 Crockenhill Road, St Mary Cray, Orpington, BR5 4DF - Road is the B258
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 96, Crockenhill Road, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping all the way down Bazalgette way, 29th October
item.description:
A large dump is between the bridge towards the sewage works and the lake, but there are smaller dumps strewn by the sides of the road from the bridge all the way down to the boat house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bazalgette Way, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches on floor blocking pavement, 29th October
item.description:
Some branches have fallen, some were pulled off by passer by (I have no idea why!). They’re scattered at the base of the tree and some were over the pavement, I moved them over.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Footbury Hill Road, Poverest, London

item.title: Lights not working, 29th October
item.description:
Under the overground railway the lights are not working. it is very dark here now that the digital ads are lighting up the path next to it. can we get these lights fixed and switched on? tfl says this is the local borough responsibility.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shoreditch High Street, Shoreditch, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.title: Street light constantly flashing day and night, 29th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Approach, New Barnet, London
